newsitem.title: USA: Keane signs Lexis-Nexis year 2000 contract.
newsitem.headline: Keane signs Lexis-Nexis year 2000 contract.

text.p: Keane Inc said Thursday it has signed a year 2000 compliance contract with Lexis-Nexis for an undisclosed amount.
Lexis-Nexis, headquartered in Dayton, Ohio, is owned by the Anglo-Dutch publishing group Reed Elsevier.

Keane said it would conduct an enterprise assessment of all of the Lexis-Nexis mission-critical applications and develop a conversion plan. The company has an estimated 25 million lines of computer code to be reviewed and certified as compliant before Jan 1, 2000.
The project should be completed by mid-year 1997, Keane said.
The Year 2000 challenge focuses on the fact that the years in many computer systems are stored as only two digits so they must be updated or replaced before the millenium.
